name: (1E)-N,N'-bis(4-methylphenyl)-2-[(4-methylphenyl)amino]ethanimidamide
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-3193
Reason: 1-ethylpiperazine base, with a melting point around 106°C, based on the fact that piperazine itself has a melting point around 106°C. The methyl group introduces a rigid structure, which can participate in hydrogen bonding, raising the melting point by approximately +5°C. The methyl group also introduces a more asymmetric structure, reducing the crystal lattice stability, which might decrease the melting point by approximately -10°C. The phenyl group introduces a more rigid structure and additional molecular weight, raising the melting point by approximately +30°C. The amino group introduces additional rigid structures that can participate in dipole interactions, raising the melting point by approximately +10°C. The carbonyl group introduces additional rigid structures that can participate in dipole interactions, raising the melting point by approximately +10°C.
